attributes.action: Change of Tomlinscote School from kilts back into grey skirts or black leggings.
attributes.additional_details: If you were a bigger size the cost would of cost above £70 the kilts are in bad condition they break easily meaning that parent's have to spend more money on buying another kilt students are complaining everyday that's the skirt is too tight and the skirts appear to become very itchy. And the cost of the skirts are becoming a problem to all parents.
attributes.background: Tomlinscote School in Frimley, brought out a kilt in 2016 start of a new term in September that students of years 7, 8 and 9 had to wear. Parents wearn't too pleased to find out they had to pay £50 extra for a brand new skirt, and depending on the child size would depend how much it is.
